alert.note: Alert for Santa Catalina and Rincon Mountains including Mount Lemmon, Summerhaven; South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 3:08PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pinal County through 345 PM MST... At 304 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of scattered thunderstorms, some very strong, from south of Florence near highway 79 to near Oracle and Mammoth. These storms were moving north at 15 mph. The strongest storm was southwest of Mammoth. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oracle, Mammoth, Saddlebrooke, San Manuel, Dudleyville, Campo Bonito, Oracle Junction and Biosphere 2. This includes the following highways... Route 77 between mile markers 89 and 131. Route 79 between mile markers 92 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Santa Catalina and Rincon Mountains including Mount Lemmon, Summerhaven; South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle
